In this session we will be discussing from the 5th verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Shri Madbhagavatam.
Sadha Itva Ajata Shatro Swam Rajyam Kitavay Ritam
Ghatayitva Asato Ragnaha Kachasparsha Kshata Ayushaha
The meaning of this verse is
The clever Duryodhana and his party cunningly usurped the kingdom of Yudhishthira who had no enemy.
By the grace of the Lord the recovery was executed and the unscrupulous kings who joined with Duryodhana were killed by him.
Others also died their duration of life having decreased for their rough handling.
The story of the hair of Queen Draupadi
In the purport Shrila Prabhupada explains
Insulting the chaste lady Draupadi cost them their very life.
It's very very dangerous and Prabhupada explains very nicely in the purport
In the glorious days or days before the advent of the king.
At the advent of the age of Kali the brahmanas, the cows, the women, the children and the old men were properly given protection.
So, five categories of persons are mentioned who require special protection of course in the Vedic culture the King protects all the citizens impartially.
But, in spite of having given them protection.
But, in spite of having given them protection.
But, in spite of having given them protection.

spite of being impartial to all the citizens, the king gives special care or protection for
five categories of persons, the brahmanas, the cows, the women, the children and old men.
Now why? That is explained by Srila Prabhupada very nicely. Number one, why protection should
be given specially for brahmanas? It is explained here, the protection of the brahmanas maintains
the institution of varana and ashrama, the most scientific culture for attainment of spiritual life.
The brahmanas are the ones who give direction to the rest of the society for everyone to attain
spiritual life.
Having got the human form of life, everyone is eligible as a human being. So brahmanas
are protected means rest of the society will get proper direction for spiritual advancement
to attain spiritual life. Number two, why cows have to be protected? That is explained
as follows.
The protection of cows maintains the most miraculous form of food. That is milk for
maintaining the finer tissues of the brain for understanding higher aims of life.
Human intelligence is special, because a human being has developed intelligence to understand
spiritual aim of life or higher aim of life than merely satisfying the senses
in gross or subtle ways. So this higher aim of life is missed out if the brain
tissues are not properly nourished. Therefore cow's milk is especially meant
for human beings in order to nourish their brain tissues to understand the
spiritual goal of life. And Srila Prabhupada many times has explained this
point that cow's milk is a miraculous form of food. For whom? For the human
beings, for the progressive human beings.
Number three, this describes why women should be protected. The protection of
women maintains the chastity of society by which we can get a good generation
for peace, tranquility and progressive life. The future depends on the quality
of the progeny that human beings are born with.
producing now. Now how can we ensure that there is a good progeny? By protecting the women.
Number four, why children should be protected? The protection of children gives the human form
of life its best chance to prepare the way of liberty from material bondage.
Such protection of children begins from the very day of begetting a child
by the purificatory process of garbhadana samskara, the beginning of pure life.
So,
certainly in modern society many people do not know what is this garbhadana samskara
or the beginning of pure life. That before a man and woman combine,
they perform this garbhadana samskara or preparation of their consciousness
in order to attract a spiritually advanced soul to take shelter of the parents as their child.
So, in this way, good population will be there in the society, resulting in a good
generation being produced for a good future.
Number five, why old men should be protected? The protection of the old men should be protected
by giving them a chance to prepare themselves for better life after death.
Of course, the entire human life is preparation for a better life after death,
but at least if one has not begun this preparation before old age comes, at least after retirement,
after getting old, one should
and must dedicate oneself completely for this preparation that's why old men

this complete outlook is based on factors leading to successful humanity

human beings but a human being is distinguished because of possessing a developed intelligence
by which the human being can make a permanent solution to all problems of material existence
by attaining spiritual life. So for attaining spiritual life, there has to be a proper organized
effort in the society, in the human society. And that organized effort is called the scientific
system of varna and ashrama. Every human being is classified according to guna and karma
to engage in a particular type of occupational activity so that they can contribute to the society and also get their means of livelihood.
And importantly, all are guided by the qualified brahmanas in order to attain spiritual life by practicing certain basic principles meant for the human being, civilized human being.
Now, Srila Prabhupada says, the killing of the above mentioned innocent creatures is totally for the benefit of the human being.
It is forbidden because even by insulting them, one loses one's duration of life.
We have a fixed duration of life when we are born, but this duration of life will not remain with us throughout our life intact.
It is not going to remain intact.
We can reduce our duration of life by insulting.
By insulting any of the five categories of persons, by insulting a brahmana or a cow or a chaste woman or innocent children or old men, by insulting any of them, our duration of life is shortened.
And here is an example that Prabhupada gives.
In the age of Kali.
They are not properly protected.
And therefore, the duration of life of the present generation has shortened considerably.
Why are we seeing shortening of the duration of life nowadays?
Because the above five categories of personalities are not given proper protection.
That is well known.
In the Bhagavad Gita, it is stated that when the women become unchaste,
for want of proper protection, there are unwanted children called Varna Sankara.
Varna Sankara means children born of unprotected women.
Such children are actually born with so many demoniac qualities.
And they actually spoil the entire human society.
Because of their bad behavior.
And the whole society becomes degraded because of such unwanted children.
So that is because women are not protected.
To insult a chaste woman means to bring about disaster in the duration of life.
Dushasana, a brother of Duryodhana, insulted Draupadi, an ideal chaste lady,
and therefore the miscreants died untimely.
All the Kauravas, 100 sons of Dhritarashtra, they all died simply because
Draupadi was insulted in that assembly when there was a gambling match.
So they tried to strip her naked.
And they were unsuccessful because Krishna protected Draupadi.
But nonetheless, their duration of life was shortened.
And they all died untimely.
Akala Mrtyu.
So, duration of life is shortened when one insults a chaste lady.
